testSteps.description: We need to check how intuitive the send message button is

assertions.text: We need to check how intuitive the entire process to use whatsapp is. Where the user is trying to search for a contact and type a message in the chat to send it. Does it feel natural and easy to use?

evidence.description: Search interface activates immediately upon tapping search bar, displaying clear filter options - good discoverability
Search results appear quickly with relevant matches, user successfully identifies target 'Me' conversation - efficient search
Tapping conversation directly opens chat thread - expected behavior, no confusion
Keyboard appears automatically, message input field clearly visible - standard messaging affordance
User begins typing seamlessly, text entry works as expected
Message sent with clear confirmation (timestamp and checkmarks) - good feedback on system status
Navigation back to chat list shows updated preview with sent message - consistent state management

assertions.explanation: The flow demonstrates a reasonably intuitive and natural experience for searching a contact and sending a message. The search functionality activates immediately with clear visual feedback (filter options appear), search results are displayed promptly and relevantly, and the messaging interface follows standard conventions with a visible text input field and successful message delivery confirmation. The user completes the entire task efficiently without apparent confusion or backtracking. Minor points preventing full confidence: the 'Ask' button that appears during search isn't explained in context, and there's a 3-second delay between completing the message and it being sent (timestamps 8.7 to 11.8), which could indicate unclear send action or system processing time.
